item.title: Pokemon Go Solgaleo Raids: Best Counters, Weaknesses, And More Tips
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A new raid boss has arrived in Pokemon Go. Solgaleo, the mascot of Pokemon Sun, is now appearing in five-star raids for a limited time.

While the legendary Pokemon has been available in the mobile game since 2022, this is the first time it's appearing as a raid boss. You previously could only obtain one by evolving Cosmoem, so if you missed your chance to get a Cosmog, this is a good opportunity to add Solgaleo to your collection.

Like other legendary Pokemon, Solgaleo is a formidable opponent, so we've put together some tips to help you beat and catch it before it leaves raids next week.

Solgaleo Raid Schedule

Solgaleo is appearing as a five-star raid boss from July 8-14, giving you less than a week to catch one before the next raid boss, Terrakion, replaces it.

Solgaleo raids will occur periodically throughout this time, but your best chance to join one will happen during the Solgaleo Raid Hour on July 9. The legendary Pokemon will take over most nearby gyms from 6-7 PM local time, giving you more opportunities than usual to battle and catch it.

Solgaleo Weaknesses

Despite its fiery appearance, Solgaleo is a psychic- and steel-type Pokemon, which makes it weak to only a handful of types.

Since psychic and steel don't share any vulnerabilities, no Pokemon type will deal quadruple damage to Solgaleo, but the following will still dish out super-effective damage against the legendary Pokemon:

  • Fire
  • Ground
  • Ghost
  • Dark

Best Solgaleo Counters

Any Pokemon that has a type advantage over Solgaleo will be helpful when battling the legendary, but here are some recommended choices to use during a Solgaleo raid:

Types To Avoid

Thanks to its typing combination, Solgaleo resists a number of popular Pokemon types. Dragon, fairy, rock, grass, ice, and normal attacks will all deal half-damage, making them ineffective when battling the legendary Pokemon. Poison and other psychic types will deal even less damage, so you'll want to avoid using those Pokemon entirely when participating in a Solgaleo raid.

Can Solgaleo Be Shiny?

Unfortunately, shiny Solgaleo is not yet available in Pokemon Go, so you'll only encounter the standard white variant when you challenge one in raids. You can get a shiny Solgaleo in other Pokemon games like Pokemon Scarlet and Violet for Nintendo Switch, but you'll need to wait a little longer before you can add one to your collection in Pokemon Go.

How To Fuse With Necrozma

Solgaleo and its counterpart Lunala are unique among legendary Pokemon in that they're able to fuse with another legendary, Necrozma.

Once you've amassed enough Solar Fusion Energy, you can fuse Solgaleo with Necrozma to form Dusk Mane Necrozma. The fusion process costs 1,000 Fusion Energy, 30 Necrozma Candy, and 30 Cosmog Candy, and the two legendary Pokemon will remain fused until you manually separate them.

Dusk Mane Necrozma is a formidable Pokemon, maintaining Solgaleo's psychic/steel typing but gaining access to some powerful moves like the steel-type Charged Attack Sunsteel Strike. This makes it a particularly good counter against fairy and ice Pokemon.

Solgaleo may be leaving raids on July 14, but there's still plenty to do over the next few weeks. Be sure to check out our Pokemon Go July events guide for a look at everything happening in the mobile game this month.

item.title: Subnautica 2 Delay May Cost Studio $250 Million Bonus - Report
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Earlier this month, the founders of Unknown Worlds--the studio behind Subnautica and its upcoming sequel, Subnautica 2--were reportedly forced out of the studio by parent company Krafton. Now, it's being alleged that Krafton's decision to delay Subnautica 2 into 2026 could cost developer Unknown Worlds' team a $250 million bonus.

According to Bloomberg, Unknown Worlds' ousted leaders--Subnautica director and designer Charlie Cleveland, Unknown Worlds co-founder Max McGuire, and CEO Ted Gill--were against delaying Subnautica 2. Cleveland recently shared his belief that Subnautica 2 is ready for early-release now, which was the original plan for the game's rollout this year.

Krafton was reportedly going to be on the hook for the $250 million bonus if Unknown Worlds reached revenue goals before the end of this year. But without Subnautica 2's early access release, those numbers are likely to fall short of those targets.

The report indicates that Unknown Worlds' former leaders planned to share the bonus with all of the studio's employees. Steve Papoutsis--the new CEO of Unknown Worlds--was reportedly asked about the bonus at a town hall meeting. Papoutsis is said to have replied that he wasn't told anything about the bonus and wasn't aware if it had been a factor in the decision to push back the game.

Krafton hasn't set a specific release date for Subnautica 2.

item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure Is Having Some Fun In The Sun With New Updates
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It's that time of the year again, and the Sunshine Celebration has returned in Hello Kitty Island Adventure once more. In the newest update for the game, out July 10, players can kick back with their favorite Sanrio characters, don festive attire, and add tropical clothing and furniture to their collection.

In addition to the celebration, another major content update for Hello Kitty Island Adventure is available now on Apple Arcade and coming soon to Nintendo Switch and Steam.

In the City Classics update, My Melody is searching for furniture, and Kuromi has become hyper-focused on everything pirates. Players can join them on a treasure hunt to unlock a new way to explore the island and unique furniture sets designed especially for those characters. Players looking for mementos can buy new Usahana and City Town souvenirs like mugs, shirts, and even a snow globe, in the Tourist Shop. Just dive into your tourist kiosk and continue to unravel the mysteries of City Town.

These are the latest updates following the big spring update back in May's Month of Meh, featuring Sanrio's eggfolk Nisetama-san and a photo challenge. These updates are free on all platforms, with more content coming soon.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure is now available on Nintendo Switch, Steam, and Apple Arcade.
